coldesc: The unique identifier of a record in the Rule table in NASIS.

collabel: Interp High Representative Value Class Key
coldesc: The unique identifier of a record in the mdruleclass table.
A user assigned name (typically connotative) for a particular interpretation rule.

An interpretation rule may contain subordinate rules, which in turn may have subordinate rules.  This is an indicator of the depth within the interpretation hierarchy that a particular rule exists, where zero is the top level.
Sequential number of the feature being described.
The unique identifier of the rule at the top of the interpretation rule hierarchy (the main rule).  Use this key to find the mail rule in the Component Interpretation table.
The unique identifier of a record in the Rule table in NASIS.
The connotative name of an interpretation.
Indicates if the corresponding interpretation is designed as a limitation, suitability or class.
A narrative text description of the logic used to generate an interpretation.
The date and time that the logic of an interpretation was last modified.
The date and time that the corresponding interpretive results for this interpretation were generated.
The maximum number of reasons recorded for the corresponding soil interpretation.
The unique identifier of a record in the Rule table in NASIS.
The rating class term for interpretation rating value from the coninterp table.
The unique identifier of a record.
General category of the versioned item.
Name or label of the application, tool, or datasource.
